meanings.definition: A powerful explosive used in construction and demolition.
meanings.sent1: The workers carefully handled the dynamites during the construction of the new building.
meanings.sent2: The dynamites were stored safely in the warehouse until they were needed for the demolition.
meanings.sent3: The dynamites decided to have a race to see who could explode first, but they all finished together!
meanings.sent4: The dynamites of creativity in his mind exploded, leading to a burst of new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The dynamites lit up the night sky with a brilliant display of destruction.

meanings.definition: To destroy or blow up with dynamite.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew dynamites the old bridge to make way for the new one.
meanings.sent2: The miners dynamite the rock to uncover valuable minerals.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was so fun, it felt like it dynamites all expectations!
meanings.sent4: Her smile dynamites any sadness in the room, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory dynamites through the town, spreading excitement everywhere.
